info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 6:31PM EDT until June 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ROCKINGHAM...SOUTH CENTRAL PAGE...NORTH CENTRAL ALBEMARLE AND SOUTHWESTERN GREENE COUNTIES... At 630 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Shenandoah, or 14 miles east of Harrisonburg, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Shenandoah, Massanutten, Stanardsville, Elkton, Mcmullen, Boonesville, Lydia, Haneytown, Mission Home, Swift Run, Amicus, Saint George and Shady Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
